title: Styling Computer Source Code
description:
Format your code No matter how nicely you style the code, it won't matter if the code looks sloppy. Make sure it uses a consistent indentation style and is flush-left.
Make sure your "smart punctuation" is smart Many blog engines rewrite content to improve typography: smart quotes, changing dash to a Unicode minus-sign, etc. This looks great in normal prose, but make sure it's not doing this to code blocks. If someone cut and pastes your code, it won't work.
